intro: Xerochlamys pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring succulent leaves and a compact growth form to reduce water loss. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
